# Question

Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Sure, here's an example function `wrap_string` in Julia that takes a string and a maximum text width as input, and returns the string with newlines inserted as needed:
```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    line = ""
    lines = String[]
    for word in words
        if length(line) + length(word) + 1 > text_width
            push!(lines, line)
            line = word
        else
            line *= " " * word
        end
    end
    push!(lines, line)
    return join(lines, '\n')
end
```
Here's an example usage of `wrap_string`:

julia> text = "This is a long string that needs to be wrapped to a maximum text width of 20 characters";
